name: Suitable Menace
description: Lore enters the synthetic ban crisis with his usual aplomb. While Doctor Jurati zeros in on how to convince Airiam to abandon her push for the ban, will you support Lore's theory that the best defense is a good offense?
rules:
-- Unique Federation and Terran Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Saru, Jurati, Lore, Soji or Cyberneticists will provide a bonus to Event Faction Missions.
-- Every Event Faction Mission you succeed at earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Victory Points to unlock Event Threshold Rewards.
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Saru, Jurati, Lore, Soji or Cyberneticists
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Hugh
featured_crew.flavor: A former Borg drone, Hugh became Executive Director of the Borg Reclamation Project.

action.name: Not a Conversation Killer at All

featured_crew.name: Lore
featured_crew.flavor: Doctor Soong's first Android with a functional positronic brain. Gifted with emotions, he was Data's older 'brother.'

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: Lore
rewards.flavor: Doctor Soong's first Android with a functional positronic brain. Gifted with emotions, he was Data's older 'brother.'

rewards.name: Maddox
rewards.flavor: A Starfleet cyberneticist, Bruce Maddox attempted to disassemble Data for study.

screens.text: "We have to understand where Airiam is coming from. Sometimes when you see a horrific future, one that seems inescapable... you'll do anything to try and keep it from coming true."

"Then why all these half-measures? If genocide--or, at least, legal personhood--is on the table, we synthetics should be taking aggressive action to defend ourselves. Let's show these meatbags who the real superior beings are."
"We're not superior just because we're stronger. And if we give in to our fears, give in to aggression, we'll become exactly what they accuse us of being. We have to show them we're no threat."

"I believe you should both be careful about assuming your own inherent natures. You may be designed, but you also evolve--which makes you no different from my people or other organics. But our captain will direct your efforts as they see fit."
"We have to understand where Airiam is coming from. Sometimes when you see a horrific future, one that seems inescapable... you'll do anything to try and keep it from coming true."

"Then why all these half-measures? If genocide--or, at least, legal personhood--is on the table, we synthetics should be taking aggressive action to defend ourselves. Let's show these meatbags who the real superior beings are."
"We're not superior just because we're stronger. And if we give in to our fears, give in to aggression, we'll become exactly what they accuse us of being. We have to show them we're no threat."

"I believe you should both be careful about assuming your own inherent natures. You may be designed, but you also evolve--which makes you no different from my people or other organics. But our captain will direct your efforts as they see fit."
